I gave this game a chance, and it was fun for the first five minutes, that's until I realized that every puzzle is so easy even a new born baby could solve it. The game itself is no longer than 20 minutes at best. The last boss was super anticlimactic, all you do is throw a ball, and that's it game beat. 

And what is with this "Cake is a lie" thing, why is it so legendary like it's the best thing since Jesus Christ. This game is truly horrendous, I am convinced that all of the reviews for the game are advanced bots or just people with some serious mental problems.

If you ever see this game avoid it at all cost, it's a stain on your life that you wish you could take back and wash yourself clean of. Steam should be paying me for even having this game in my library.

Ich finde die Portal mechanik Cool. Ich hab das Spiel mal davor vor bestimmt 5-8 Jahren mal auf Youtube gesehen und wusste deswegen noch ungefähr die hälfte der Puzzle, selbst wenn die nicht so schwierig waren. Ich fand das Spiel gut. Die Story hinter dem Spiel, die Easter eggs waren gut, die eingeführten mechaniken waren gut und Ich fand den Soundtrack sehr cool.  Ich hab keine Bugs gefunden die wirklich nervig waren, es gab zwar welche aber die waren nicht besonders schlimm. Also naja Ich kann es nur empfehlen der Puzzle mag, aber irgendwie finde Ich ist die Portal reihe einfach etwas das muss man mindestens mal erlebt haben.
고전이지만, 낡은게 아니라 클래식합니다.
Самая лучшая головоломка в которую я играл!

I'm not a big gamer. In fact Portal is the first modern PC game I've played properly. i found it easy to learn and it offered me easy and difficult challenges. I was surprised to finish it in such a short time but I'm looking forward to playing it again and playing the second one.

When I bought this game I had heard so much about it and I was very excited. Whenever I'm going to a party, to watch a new movie or something as insignificant as buying new shoes for example, I get this really excited feeling for something new. It's probably because my life is really boring and even the smallest things are highlights. The game is incredibly old but it doesn't feel that outdated. It really was ahead of its time back then. I would def recommend this classic if you haven't experienced it already.

Great game, easy to learn but really starts to become a challenge in the later chambers. The process of teaching you new techniques and then combining them all in the last few levels is fun, and it feels rewarding once you finish a challenging level (namely 18). The fights are good and the final chamber is amazing. Great story and definitely worth the $9.99. Remember, the cake is a lie.

Portal is absolutely one of the finest crafted puzzle games I have ever played. With some great mechanics, mind-bending puzzles, and great story, it's obvious why this game has become as beloved as it is.
